intro: Ostrearia australina, commonly known as the Australian sea holly, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its striking, blue or violet flowers that resemble those of the sea holly genus. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. Ostrearia australina is often found in open habitats such as coastal heathlands and dunes.
